Class LogServerActor

java.lang.Object
com.scivicslab.actoriac.cli.LogServerActor
public class LogServerActor extends Object
Actor that wraps the H2 TCP server and HTTP info server.

This POJO actor manages the lifecycle of both servers and tracks connection activity for auto-shutdown functionality.

State Tracking:

  • Tracks last activity time (session creation, log writes)
  • Tracks active connection count via TCP port inspection
  • Provides shutdown method for graceful termination
Since:
2.11.0
Author:
devteam@scivics-lab.com

  • Constructor Details

    • LogServerActor

      public LogServerActor(int tcpPort, int httpPort, File dbPath, boolean verbose)
      Creates a new LogServerActor.
      Parameters:
      tcpPort - H2 TCP port
      httpPort - HTTP info API port
      dbPath - database file path (without extension)
      verbose - enable verbose logging

  • Method Details

    • start

      public void start(CountDownLatch latch) throws Exception
      Starts both TCP and HTTP servers.
      Parameters:
      latch - countdown latch to signal when server stops
      Throws:
      Exception - if server startup fails

    • stop

      public void stop()
      Stops both servers gracefully.

    • isRunning

      public boolean isRunning()
      Checks if the server is currently running.

    • getActiveConnectionCount

      public int getActiveConnectionCount()
      Gets the number of active TCP connections to this server. Uses netstat/ss to count established connections.
      Returns:
      number of active connections, or -1 if unable to determine

    • getIdleTimeMillis

      public long getIdleTimeMillis()
      Gets the time since last activity in milliseconds.

    • recordActivity

      public void recordActivity()
      Records that activity occurred (called when sessions are created or logs written).

    • checkForNewActivity

      public boolean checkForNewActivity()
      Checks if there has been any database activity since last check. Compares session count to detect new sessions.
      Returns:
      true if new sessions were created

    • getSessionCount

      public int getSessionCount()
      Gets the current session count from the database.
